text: Goh Keng Swee (; Pe̍h-ōe-jī: Gô͘ Khèng-sūi; 6 October 1918 – 14 May 2010) was the second Deputy Prime Minister of Singapore between 1973 and 1984, and a Member of Parliament for the Kreta Ayer constituency for a quarter of a century. Goh died in the early morning of 14 May 2010 at the age of 91.. See also . His body lay in state at Parliament House from 20 to 22 May.; . A state funeral was held on 23 May 2010 at the Singapore Conference Hall. After the ceremony, a private ceremony for family members was held at the Mandai Crematorium.; ; ; . As a mark of respect, the State flag was flown at half- mast from all Government buildings between 20 and 23 May.. ==References== Category:1918 births Category:2010 deaths Category:Political office-holders in Singapore Category:People's Action Party (Singapore) politicians
title: Goh Keng Swee
